dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Udana b Sandakan 84 (87b 4x4 1x6 120m) SR: 96.55

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! He's picked out short third in trying to play a reverse sweep. It was struck hard and struck well but he hit it straight to the fielder. End of a fabulous knock, one that has turned around Bangladesh's fortunes. From a stuttering innings, he's put them into fourth gear. Can they find the finishing kick?

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b DM de Silva 54 (76b 2x4 1x6 96m) SR: 71.05

dismissalComment.html: got him! The ball sneaked through the the gap between bat and pad as he tried to swing it into the leg side. Deceived completely in flight

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal portrait
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Tamim Iqbal headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal headshot

dismissalComment.html: Tamim has outfoxed himself! He goes to the leg side while the bowler's running in. Then comes back into regular position while Dhananjaya releases the ball. It's a yorker, and this has hit Tamim's boots. Appeal for lbw and given. Tamim reviews but it's pitching in line, hitting in line, and crashing into middle and leg. Tamim's gone

image.caption: Mohammad Mithun portrait
image.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun portrait, April 2020

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Mithun player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: two in two? Dhananjaya is smiling. Fullish, outside off and turning in. Mithun wants to play the paddle sweep, but it hits his pad. Appeal for lbw and given. Mithun reviews right away but there's no bat/glove involved. Impact in line, hitting leg stump. Bangladesh lose two reviews in two balls

dismissalText.long: c DM de Silva b Chameera
dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c DM de Silva b Chameera 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: straight to first slip! Full, in the slot for Liton to put away if the bat's flourish was better. It ends up moving away slightly, and Liton's drive takes the edge to first slip. Taken by the fielder in front of his face, Dhananjaya with the sharp catch

dismissalText.commentary: Wanindu Hasaranga c Afif Hossain b Mohammad Saifuddin 74 (60b 3x4 5x6 77m) SR: 123.33

dismissalText.commentary: Kusal Perera b Mehidy Hasan Miraz 30 (50b 1x4 0x6 92m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: got him and it's a massive strike! KJP's stumps go for a walk. This is pushed through quicker, the ball drifts in with the angle, skids through and beats Kusal's attempt to cut. Mehidy belts out a roar, how delighted he is. It was a very subdued knock until this point from KJP

headshotImage.longCaption: Dhananjaya de Silva player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mehidy has turned this game around big time. Dhananjaya gets inside the line to help it with the spin over short fine but ends up missing it completely as the ball deflects off the pad and onto the stumps

image.caption: Ashen Bandara player page headshot cutout, 2021
image.longCaption: Ashen Bandara player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ashen Bandara player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashen Bandara player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's got him with a terrific delivery. Mehidy is showing his bag of tricks and Sri Lanka have no clue presently. This is lovely. Sees Bandara stepping out and fires this in on a length, the ball fizzes through off the pitch to beat his wild swing and crash into the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Pathum Nissaka player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Pathum Nissaka player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Another one! A promising innings ends too soon. Length ball, doesn't bounce as much as you'd like to execute the pull over the infield. Not off the middle, and Afif laps it up at midwicket

image.caption: Isuru Udana portrait
image.longCaption: Isuru Udana, June 2020

headshotImage.caption: Isuru Udana  player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Isuru Udana  player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: good length, on middle. Tries to slog with no footwork, and takena at deep midwicket! That's two wickets in two, and Bangladesh are once again cruising.

image.caption: Dushmantha Chameera portrait
image.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera, June 2020

headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's the end of that. Mustafiz goes full, rolls his fingers over the seam. The ball wobbles away a bit, he looks to heave across the line but ends up getting a leading edge which Saifuddin pouches safely running to his left at backward point. Bangladesh lead the series 1-0.

commentTextItems.html: that's the end of that. Mustafiz goes full, rolls his fingers over the seam. The ball wobbles away a bit, he looks to heave across the line but ends up getting a leading edge which Saifuddin pouches safely running to his left at backward point. Bangladesh lead the series 1-0.

commentPostTextItems.html: Right. That brings us to the end of our coverage for today. On behalf of Sreshth and Thilak, this is Shashank saying goodbye.

Tamim Iqbal: "Happy with the way we fought. Mushfiqur, Mahmudullah were superb. Young Afif batted superbly. We did a decent job scoring 250 because it was two-paced. Definitely good to get back to winning ways. Losing is no fun, we lost 10 games across formats in a row. Winning is happiness. Still got two games, hope to continue this."

Mushfiqur Rahim is Player of the Match for his 84 off 87 balls. "It wasn't an easy wicket to bat on. When Shakib, Liton got out early, there was pressure. Tamim batted well, allowed me to take my time. And then Riyad bhai was superb. I am not a big guy, not a Pollard or Russell, I stuck to my strengths, took my time. I had to keep one end safe and that's what I did. The finishing touch from Riyad and Afif was superb. These conditions aren't ideal to play, it's not just hot, the humidity takes a lot out of you but credit to our players."

Kusal Perera: "Not good to end on the losing side, but there are a lot of positives. Wanindu was superb. We bowled well. Bangladesh are a good side, our bowlers aren't experienced but they did well to restrict them to 257. Hasaranga is highly-rated, he backs his strength and to bowl 10 overs in these conditions was a great effort. The top-order batsmen need to bat at least 30-35 overs. Isuru and Wanindu gave us a chance, but credit to their bowlers. We have two games and we have to come back strongly."

9.00pm Three wickets for Mustafizur, but it was Mehidy who broke the back of Sri Lanka's chase with key strikes in the middle. Wanindu Hasaranga threatened to pull off a coup but had little support at the other end.

Where did Bangladesh turn it around? It was in the middle overs, when Mushfiqur Rahim and Mahmudullah put on a 107-run fifth-wicket partnership to help raise Bangladesh to 257 for 6. It was a proper exhibition of risk-free cricket: the pair only hit six fours and two sixes between them, preferring to accumulate safely against the spinners through the middle overs, after having come together with the team in mild trouble.

Mushfiqur put together the more impressive individual innings of the two, hitting 84 off 87, while Mahmudullah made 54 off 76. Earlier, Tamim, the captain, led the way with a half-century off his own.

dismissalComment.html: oh dear! He's picked out short third in trying to play a reverse sweep. It was struck hard and struck well but he hit it straight to the fielder.
